column4: does a fresh install of ubuntu have a firewall already installed?

a website says: Iptables is a firewall, installed by default on all official Ubuntu distributions (Ubuntu, Kubuntu, Xubuntu). When you install Ubuntu, iptables is there, but it allows all traffic by default..   Whats that mean?

iptables is the kernel firewall.  It can be compiled built-in or as a module.  Most distros include it as a module, installed by default.  Some will include some default rules.  Ubuntu doesn't include any.
